events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th, resulting in vehicle damage and started the claim process.
After reviewing the submitted claim form, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the nature of the reported incident.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the investigation and communication with the customer to ensure a smooth claim process.
The insurance company sent an official acknowledgment confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and initiating further steps.
Requested supporting documents from the claimant, including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including official police report and multiple pictures showing collision damage.
The claims investigation team began assessing the evidence and circumstances surrounding the auto accident for liability and damage evaluation.
Investigation concluded with findings supporting the claimant’s description; vehicle collision caused by another driver’s negligence.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover vehicle repair costs and loss of use during repair period, based on the investigation findings.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement amount and expressed satisfaction with the communication throughout the process.
Claim approval was granted following customer agreement to the terms of the settlement related to the vehicle collision damages.
The insurance company issued payment to cover the repair work and related expenses as per the approved settlement.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after all payments were completed and final confirmations received from the customer.
The case files and documents related to the auto collision claim were archived for record-keeping and future reference as needed.
